intro: Geissorhiza pseudinaequalis, commonly known as the red-flowered geissorhiza, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces erect, branching stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
